articles.description: Listen to Radio 5 Live commentary and follow text updates as England face Japan at the Rugby World Cup in Nice.
articles.title: Rugby World Cup: England v Japan build-up - radio & text

articles.description: Great Britain take on France for a place in the Davis Cup knockout stage, with Dan Evans playing Arthur Fils in the first singles - watch and text.
articles.title: Davis Cup: Evans v Fils as Great Britain face France - watch & text

articles.description: Fiji beat Australia for just the third time in their history and blow Pool C wide open with a thrilling win at the Rugby World Cup.
articles.title: Fiji beat Australia at World Cup for first time

articles.description: Follow live BBC Three coverage from the Diamond League finals in Eugene as GB's Keely Hodgkinson & Jeema Reekie face Athing Mu & Mary Moraa again, plus Shericka Jackson & Armand Duplantis compete.
articles.title: Watch: Diamond League finals - Hodgkinson v Mu, plus Jackson & Duplantis compete

articles.description: Arsenal move fourth in the Premier League by beating winless Everton through Leandro Trossard's 69th-minute strike at Goodison Park.
articles.title: Trossard strike earns Arsenal victory at Everton

articles.description: Carlos Sainz wins the Singapore Grand Prix with a controlled drive for Ferrari that ends Max Verstappen and Red Bull's winning run.
articles.title: Sainz wins breathless Singapore GP to end Red Bull run

articles.description: Follow live text updates as Real Madrid host Real Sociedad in La Liga at the Bernabeu.
articles.title: La Liga: Real Madrid v Real Sociedad build-up - follow live

articles.description: Ronnie O'Sullivan says he never keeps the trophy after winning a fourth straight Shanghai Masters title with an 11-9 win over Luca Brecel.
articles.title: O'Sullivan to give trophy away after Shanghai win

articles.description: New Zealander Ryan Fox makes six birdies in the back nine of his final round at Wentworth to win the BMW PGA Championship by one shot.
articles.title: Brilliant back nine fires Fox to Wentworth win

articles.description: England drop Jason Roy from their final World Cup squad and call up Harry Brook.
articles.title: Brook replaces Roy in England World Cup squad
